title: HSC6002 Evidence-based Practice and Ethics | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module develops competencies in research design, critical appraisal, and ethical behaviours in clinical practice, with a focus on evidence-based practice.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This module develops competencies in research design, critical appraisal, and ethical behaviours in clinical practice, with a focus on evidence-based practice.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation

This module has an updated learning pathway that can now be stacked towards various Graduate Certificates and Graduate Diplomas under the Health and Social Sciences domain. These Graduate Certificates and Graduate Diplomas are also stackable towards

This module explores the application of research evidence in clinical practice. To do so, knowledge and competencies in research design, statistical interpretation, and critical appraisal will be developed.

Learners will be engaged in the full process of evidence-based practice through identifying a clinical area of interest, critically appraising relevant literature, identifying gaps in evidence, the barriers and facilitators, and the evaluation of evidence-based practice approach.

They will have the opportunity to reflect deeply on your personal and societal values, professionalism, and how both values and professionalism shape their ethical behaviours in clinical practice. Learners will also have the opportunity to explore the tension between organisational and societal demands. It is hoped that this module will provide clarity on ethical dilemmas for health professionals in their everyday interactions with patients and clients.

The module uses blended learning pedagogy and flexible scheduling for adult learners. The learning activities and assessment strategies reflect workplace demands, upskill module participants' knowledge and practice, and enhance service delivery.
Related and relevant health-science-related qualifications and working experience
Documents and information you would need to complete this application:
Please upload documents under Online Applications - Supporting Documents section.
Employment support letter (Includes applicant's area of work)*
Recognised BSc degree in any of the health sciences registrable with the local regulatory bodies*
Your reasons for pursuing the module (100 - 150 words)
Why did you select SIT over other academic institutions? (100 - 150 words)
What do you hope to achieve at the completion of the module? (100 - 150 words)
Developing a database search and retrieving the articles grey literature
Cultural and socio-political influences in healthcare
Ethical issues within profession and at the workplace
Research design and methods of appraisal
Interpreting research findings for use in the clinical setting
Ethical aspects of research translation into practice
Barriers and Facilitators to implementation of EBP
Associate Prof/Director of Prog, Health and Social Sciences, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Prof/Director of Prog, Health and Social Sciences, Singapore Institute of Technology

Associate Professor Li Khim Kwah (or Khim Kwah) is a physiotherapist trained in Sydney, Australia. Khim has been a physiotherapist since 2004 and completed her undergraduate and postgraduate studies at the University of Sydney. She has held senior academic and senior clinical positions at universities and hospitals in Sydney before returning home to Singapore in 2018. Khim’s teaching areas include neurological physiotherapy, evidence-based practice and clinical reasoning, while her research areas focus on predicting recovery, and improving physical activity in people with stroke/other mobility limitations. Khim is currently Deputy Cluster Director of the Health and Social Sciences Cluster at Singapore Institute of Technology.
Evidence Based Practice (EBP) – what it is and what it is not
Applying the results in clinical practice
Assessing the results in clinical practice
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit-bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Graduate Certificate and Graduate Diploma qualifications
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$4,469.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Graduate Certificate in Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation (Modular Certification Pathway) equips allied health professionals with clinical-focused skills to address the healthcare needs of Singapore's ageing population.
Graduate Certificate in Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation

The Graduate Certificate in Medical Sonography (Modular Certification Pathway) equips sonographers with professional knowledge and advanced skills, enabling them to work as highly proficient ultrasound practitioners.
The Graduate Certificate in Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy (Modular Certification Pathway) equips physiotherapists with skills in managing pain and dysfunction using a holistic approach.
The Graduate Certificate in Organ Transplant Nursing (Modular Certification Pathway) equips nurses with specialised skills for post-transplant care and rehabilitation.
Graduate Certificate in Organ Transplant Nursing
The Graduate Certificate in Rehabilitation Nursing (Modular Certification Pathway) equips nurses with essential skills in leadership, advocacy, and multidisciplinary rehabilitation practices.
Improving Patient Outcomes through Advanced Clinical Supervision Competency

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) taps on evidence-based education practices to address the increasing demand for advanced clinical supervision competencies among Allied Health Professionals and improve patient outcomes.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Competency-based Education
Shedding Light on Workplace Safety in Social Services
These niche courses equip professionals in social service agencies with the skills to optimise health and safety at the workplace.
Health Sciences, Social Sciences, Workplace Safety and Health
Armed with a Postgraduate Diploma in Sonography, Florence Tan is ready for advanced clinical practice and leadership.
Redefining Thinking and Learning at SkillsFuture Festival

The annual SkillsFuture Festival to promote lifelong learning was hosted by the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) this year on 23 July. Riding on the theme of ‘Design for the Future Economy’, the single-day event featured 53 learning workshops and talks, with SIT faculty staff sharing their expert insights on thinking and learning.
Design Innovation, Leadership and Communication, Health Sciences
With the ageing population in Singapore, there has been a paradigm shift from structured institutionalised care to a more person-centric approach.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Design Innovation
As Singapore's ageing population continues to grow, care for the elderly is becoming a pressing issue.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation
This intensive workshop provides theoretical and practical skills in small parts ultrasound, including scrotal, penile, thyroid, parathyroid, salivary glands, and lymph nodes.

This intensive workshop provides theoretical and practical skills in breast ultrasound and imaging of lumps and bumps, including intervention work, advanced imaging techniques, and interpretation of abnormal findings.
This workshop provides advanced theoretical knowledge and practical skills for sonographers in paediatric and neonatal ultrasound, including imaging techniques and diagnostic processes.
Interprofessional Low Vision Rehabilitation: Basic Foundations
This course equips healthcare professionals to manage low vision patients, develop assessment skills, support psychosocial adjustment and more.
Occupational Therapy, Physiotherapy, Nursing, Health Sciences
This course is designed to equip AHP clinical supervisors and educators with the skills to provide effective clinical training to AHPs and students.
Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Health Sciences
This course equips occupational therapists with skills in occupational therapy-centric cognitive-perceptual assessments, problem identification, goal setting, and intervention plans.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Occupational Therapy
